alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Evangeline; Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 12:31PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Lafayette, southeastern Evangeline, northern Acadia, west central St. Martin and central St. Landry Parishes through 100 PM CDT... At 1231 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Richard, or near Church Point, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Opelousas, Eunice, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Rayne, Carencro, Ville Platte, Church Point, Mamou, Iota, Leonville, Arnaudville, Sunset, Port Barre, Duson, Washington, Grand Coteau, Cankton and Chataignier. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 86 and 111. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Acadia; Evangeline; Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin
